data.text: Behold, the Lord maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste,
And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest;
The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled:
The earth mourneth and fadeth away,
The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof;
Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth,
The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth,
The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth,
They shall not drink wine with a song;
The city of confusion is broken down:
There is a crying for wine in the streets;
In the city is left desolation,
When thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the people,
They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing,
Wherefore glorify ye the Lord in the fires,
From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even glory to the righteous.
Fear, and the pit, and the snare,
And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit;
The earth is utterly broken down,
The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard,
And it shall come to pass in that day,
And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit,
Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed,
